title: New NBA mock draft: With Flagg, Harper and Bailey slotted to teams, we project all 59 picks
content: With the Mavericks winning the lottery and the right to draft Cooper Flagg, here's ESPN's updated two-round mock.

title: Bengals' Hendrickson: Won't play on current deal
content: Trey Hendrickson said Tuesday that he won't play for the Bengals this season under his current contract in an apparent escalation of his dispute with the team.

title: Tatum carried off in Celtics' Game 4 loss; MRI next
content: Celtics star Jayson Tatum will have an MRI on Tuesday after suffering an apparent noncontact lower leg injury late in the fourth quarter of Boston's Game 4 loss to the Knicks on Monday night.

title: NHL bans Panthers minority owner for posts on X
content: Florida Panthers minority owner Doug Cifu has been suspended by the NHL for a series of offensive social media posts on Sunday night.

title: Vikings draw historic double in international slate
content: The Vikings will become the first team in NFL history to play consecutive international games in different countries this season.

title: DeChambeau, Koepka at U.S. Ryder Cup dinner
content: Bryson DeChambeau and Brooks Koepka of LIV Golf attended a team dinner hosted by United States Ryder Cup captain Keegan Bradley in Philadelphia last week.

title: Gold medal wrestler charged in prostitution sting
content: Olympic gold medalist Kyle Snyder, one of the most successful wrestlers in U.S. history, was arrested in a prostitution sting in Columbus, Ohio.

title: Oh, snap: Two plays cost Pack guard $2M raise
content: Packers guard Sean Rhyan missed out on a raise of more than $2 million by just two snaps during his first three seasons.

title: ESPN's DTC streaming service set for fall launch
content: ESPN's new direct-to-consumer streaming service will launch in early fall, chairman Jimmy Pitaro announced Tuesday.

title: üèà Offseason rankings for Power 4 CFB teams
content: Nail the transfer portal? Miss a big recruit? Find a top coordinator job? All are part of a college team's offseason.

title: Will Marvin Harrison Jr. break out? Can Ladd McConkey be a No. 1? Key questions on 13 second-year NFL WRs
content: We answered big questions about top receivers from the 2024 draft class, including Marvin Harrison Jr., Ladd McConkey and Malik Nabers.

title: Why Travis Hunter is ready to become a star as first full-time two-way player in 60 years
content: The Jags plan to play Hunter on both offense and defense, and those who have coached him think he will thrive.

title: Rested, recharged, stronger than ever: How Fever's Caitlin Clark used offseason to reset
content: When cameras weren't catching her hanging with Taylor Swift, Caitlin Clark honed her game on the court and in the weight room.

title: Why a Celtics series loss to the Knicks could have massive ramifications this offseason
content: With the Celtics down 3-1, and Jayson Tatum's future uncertain, their viability as a group is in question.

title: Three reasons the Rockies may be the worst MLB team of all time
content: Sorry, Chicago. There's a club in Denver taking being bad to an all new low -- and this is how they're doing it.

title: No school, no field ... and for some, no home: How the Palisades Dolphins rose from the ashes
content: The California wildfires shook their lives. Now, as a chaotic -- but much-needed -- baseball season concludes, the future of their team is in doubt.

title: Why the Nuggets' title hopes might hinge on the most volatile player in the NBA
content: Russell Westbrook is perhaps the NBA's most polarizing player. He has single-handedly won and lost games for the Nuggets. But make no mistake: Denver wouldn't be here without him.

title: Trends and shocking takeaways from the Stanley Cup playoffs' second round
content: As we approach the elimination games in Round 2, here are the major storylines -- and what comes next.

title: Stanley Cup playoffs daily: What to watch in critical Game 4 of Stars-Jets
content: Will Dallas go up 3-1, or can Winnipeg tie it at 2-2? Game 4 keys, plus highlights, top players from Monday.

title: 10 moves that shaped the WNBA offseason -- and what they mean for 2025
content: Seven head coaching changes. Veterans on the move. Teams rebuilding. Here's a rundown of the key developments.

title: Ranking the top 25 WNBA players
content: How do A'ja Wilson, Napheesa Collier, Breanna Stewart and Caitlin Clark stack up in our preseason rankings?

title: PGA Championship tier rankings: From Scottie and Rory to just happy to make the cut
content: Can Rory McIlroy win his second major of the year? Which LIV golfers can contend? We break down the PGA Championship at Quail Hollow (Starts Thursday on ESPN/ESPN+).

title: USWNT celebrates 40 years with beautifully complementary kits
content: To celebrate 40 years of the U.S. women's national team, Nike has unveiled kits defined by stars and stripes.

title: Ancelotti on Madrid exit, Brazil deal: 'No drama'
content: Carlo Ancelotti said there's "no need for drama" around his departure from Real Madrid, insisting he remains "totally focused" but admitting the team might need "fresh impetus" after confirming that he'll leave to take charge of Brazil.

title: Cristiano Ronaldo's son makes Portugal U15 debut
content: Cristiano Ronaldo's eldest son, Cristiano Ronaldo J√∫nior, made his debut for Portugal under-15s on Tuesday in a 4-1 win against Japan.

title: Sources: Spurs plan parade for UEL win, Utd won't
content: Tottenham plan to hold a parade if they win the Europa League while opponents Man United have decided against one if they win.

title: Alex Morgan invests in NWSL's San Diego Wave
content: Two-time World Cup winner and Olympic champion Alex Morgan is the newest minority investor in San Diego Wave FC.

title: Deco expects Yamal to sign new Barcelona deal
content: Barcelona sporting director Deco has told ESPN he expects Lamine Yamal to sign a new contract and make history at the club as part of an exciting generation of youngsters.

title: Goodison the permanent home of Everton Women
content: Everton have announced that Goodison Park will become the permanent home for their women's side from the start of next season.

title: Mascherano: Everything not 'fine' at Inter Miami
content: Inter Miami CF coach Javier Mascherano has stated that "there are things that need to be corrected" following a poor run of form and 4-1 defeat to Minnesota United on Saturday.

title: Sources: Madrid close to signing Trent for CWC
content: Real Madrid are also looking at Benfica's √Ålvaro Carreras and Dean Huijsen of Bournemouth as defensive reinforcements, sources told ESPN.

title: Are Liverpool proof coaches don't matter? Or is Slot just better than Klopp?
content: Liverpool were supposed to struggle once Jurgen Klopp left. Instead, Arne Slot won the Premier League. Do coaches just not matter?

title: Stanley Cup playoff odds: Mikko Rantanen second in Conn Smythe odds
content: Every playoff team's odds to win the 2025 Stanley Cup and favorites for the Conn Smythe Trophy for playoff MVP.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Delap to choose Man United over Chelsea
content: Manchester United have moved ahead of Chelsea in the race to sign Liam Delap. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: 'US has chickened out': How Xi called Trump's bluff on trade war
content: In a surprising turn, the US and China have agreed to de-escalate their trade war, with the US significantly reducing tariffs on Chinese goods. Beijing responded by lowering its tariffs on US products. This truce, reached in Geneva, has stunned markets and analysts, as it appears China secured its objectives without major economic reforms.

title: 'Force of Indian arms ...': MEA reiterates trade not discussed in US talks
content: India's Ministry of External Affairs refuted Donald Trump's claim that trade was used as leverage to broker a ceasefire with Pakistan during Operation Sindoor. The MEA emphasized that the ceasefire was a result of Pakistan's request after Indian strikes on its air bases.

title: US-China trade: Trump says he called Apple CEO after China tariff rollback and ...
content: Following a US-China trade agreement where tariffs are suspended for 90 days, President Trump claimed Apple CEO Tim Cook plans to increase US investments, potentially building more plants. This news follows reports of Apple considering iPhone price hikes, possibly linked to tariffs.

title: How US-China trade deal will likely impact India - Explained
content: The US-China trade agreement, temporarily reducing tariffs, poses challenges for India's trade negotiations with the US. Securing a favorable bilateral trade agreement with the US and leveraging domestic strengths are crucial for India to remain competitive in the global supply chain.

title: ‚ÄòWe need to leave...‚Äô: Alyssa Healy recollects Dharamsala experience
content: Australian cricketer Alyssa Healy recounted a harrowing experience during the IPL 2025 in Dharamsala. A security threat, involving a reported airspace breach, triggered an emergency evacuation. Players and families were rushed to safety amidst confusion and fear, with stadium lights blacked out. The IPL was temporarily suspended but has since resumed with a revised schedule and heightened security measures.

title: Op Sindoor: 'My eyes welled up when it worked so well,' says the man behind Akash
content: The indigenous Akash missile defence system, developed over 15 years by Indian scientists, successfully countered Pakistani drone and missile attacks along the western border. Prahlada Ramarao, the project director, expressed immense pride in the system's performance, highlighting its cost-effectiveness. Inspired by Dr. APJ Abdul Kalam, the project overcame challenges in developing the Rajendra radar.

title: Microsoft announces second-biggest job cuts in its history: We continue to ‚Ä¶
content: Microsoft will reduce its workforce by 3%. This affects about 7,000 employees globally. The company aims to streamline operations. Microsoft seeks a flatter structure. It prioritizes engineering talent for AI. New performance management includes a rehire ban. Microsoft follows an industry trend. Other tech firms also focus on efficiency. These changes follow better-than-expected quarterly results.

title: Chinese defence stocks drop up to 9% after rising during Op Sindoor
content: Chinese defence stocks plummeted following a ceasefire between India and Pakistan, erasing earlier gains fueled by expectations of increased arms sales to Pakistan. The Hang Seng China A Aerospace & Defence Index saw a significant drop, with companies like AVIC Chengdu Aircraft and Zhuzhou Hongda experiencing substantial losses.

title: Did Donald Trump tell 'Ozempic Santa Elon Musk': ...it‚Äôs not working
content: President Trump shared an anecdote about a wealthy friend's experience with inflated drug prices in the U.S., prompting a drug company executive to admit to overcharging Americans. This occurred as Trump signed an executive order aimed at drastically reducing pharmaceutical costs by aligning them with international prices.

title: 'TRF a front of LeT; will push for it to be listed as terror entity at UNSC': MEA
content: India is set to push for the United Nations to designate The Resistance Front (TRF), an offshoot of Lashkar-e-Taiba, as a terrorist organization following several attacks in Jammu and Kashmir. The Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) announced plans to send a team to the UNSC's 1267 Sanctions Committee meeting this week to pursue sanctions and travel bans on TRF members.

title: Random Musings: If K-Pop fans don't get ya, Beer Biceps must
content: There are millions of fights going on at the same time. There‚Äôs Kohli vs Rohit, BTS vs Blackpink, Messi vs Ronaldo, Ranbir vs Ranveer fans, Salman vs SRK, ChatGPT vs Gemini, Trads vs Raytas, BJP vs Congress IT Cells ‚Äì but all internecine fights were put to rest amid the siren call of war and Indians became unhinged dogs of war against anyone trying to push Pakistan‚Äôs narrative: Pakistanis with VPNs who were on Twitter, YouTube channels pushing the Pakistani agenda, or even mainstream publications pushing Pakistan‚Äôs narrative without any fact checks.

title: Indian Army briefs 70 nations on successful conduct of Operation Sindoor
content: Lt Gen D S Rana briefed defence attaches from 70 nations on Operation Sindoor's success, highlighting its impact on India-Pakistan relations. He emphasized India's military superiority and precise targeting of terror-linked sites. The briefing also addressed misinformation campaigns and showcased the integrated approach and technological advancements used in the operation.

title: 'Awami League ban in Bangladesh without due process is concerning': India
content: India has voiced strong concerns over the recent political turmoil in Bangladesh, triggered by the banning of the Awami League under a revised anti-terrorism law. This action, along with the revocation of the party's registration, raises worries about shrinking democratic space. India urges Bangladesh to hold free and fair elections, emphasizing the importance of democratic freedoms.

title: Angry paps confront Virat Kohli at Mumbai airport
content: Following Virat Kohli's Test retirement announcement, paparazzi at the Mumbai airport expressed their disappointment, stating they would no longer watch cricket. Kohli, accompanied by Anushka Sharma, politely declined photos due to time constraints.

title: ‚ÄòDon‚Äôt politically penalise Modi govt for exploring peace‚Äô: Mufti
content: PDP chief Mehbooba Mufti urged opposition parties to support the Modi government's peace initiatives, particularly the recent ceasefire. She emphasized the need for bipartisan statesmanship and a national consensus, drawing parallels to past leaders who engaged across borders during tense times. Mufti also criticized media narratives for distracting from real issues and fueling division.

title: Bomb scare delays Mumbai-bound flight at Kolkata airport, passenger detained
content: A passenger on an IndiGo flight from Kolkata to Mumbai triggered a bomb scare at Kolkata airport, leading to heightened security measures. The 26-year-old man made the suspicious comment during a pre-boarding security check, prompting immediate detention and a thorough inspection of the aircraft in an isolation bay.

title: 'I saw Test cricket mainly for Virat Kohli': Preity Zinta
content: Preity Zinta expressed her admiration for Virat Kohli's transformative impact on Test cricket following his sudden retirement. She highlighted his passion, character, and competitiveness, suggesting the game won't be the same. Zinta also acknowledged the significant void left by Kohli, Rohit Sharma and Ashwin, emphasizing the challenge for current players to fill their shoes.

title: Owaisi takes 'leased Chinese aircraft' swipe at Shehbaz Sharif, Asim Munir
content: Asaduddin Owaisi mocked Pakistan's Prime Minister and army chief after the Indian Air Force reportedly struck the Rahim Yar Khan airbase in Pakistan. The strike, part of a retaliation for Pakistan's actions, rendered the runway non-operational. India's response followed a terrorist attack and included precision strikes on terror facilities, resulting in significant casualties.

title: Jos Buttler, Phil Salt set to miss rest of IPL 2025?
content: England Cricket embarks on a fresh chapter under captain Harry Brook, hosting Zimbabwe in a Test match before facing West Indies in ODIs and T20Is. Despite IPL 2025 clashes, key players like Buttler and Archer are available. Dawson and Wood return to the T20I squad, while Hartley joins the ODI setup.

title: Hailee Steinfeld drops major career bombshell after breakup advice goes viral
content: Hailee Steinfeld, known for her acting and singing career, is connecting with fans through emotional honesty and personal storytelling. From her role in 'Sinners' to her BEAU SOCIETY newsletter, she shares her experiences with identity, heartbreak, and self-discovery. Steinfeld's approach redefines celebrity engagement, making her a relatable voice for a generation navigating life's challenges.

title: April inflation hits multi-year low of 3.16%
content: The All India Consumer Price Index (CPI) or retail inflation for the month of April 2025 eased to 3.16% compared to April 2024. The food inflation experienced a significant reduction of 91 basis points in April 2025 compared to March 2025, marking its lowest point since October 2021.

title: Operation Keller: 3 LeT terrorists killed during encounter with Army in J&K's Shopian
content: Indian armed forces neutralized three Lashkar-e-Taiba terrorists in Shopian's Keller area, Jammu and Kashmir, following a search operation prompted by specific intelligence. This action follows India's declaration that future terror acts will be treated as acts of war, signaling a tougher stance against Pakistan-based groups.

title: PM Modi poses in front of S-400 missile system, sends message to Pakistan
content: Prime Minister Modi refuted Pakistan's claim of destroying India's S-400 air defense system by visiting the Adampur airbase and posing with the system. This follows Pakistan's disinformation campaign, including false videos, after India's Operation Sindoor. The Ministry of External Affairs exposed Pakistan's false claims about damaging the S-400 and BrahMos missile base.

title: Explained: How India's punitive steps will continue to hit Pakistan
content: Despite the India-Pakistan ceasefire, India's economic measures against Pakistan remain in effect. These actions, initiated after the Pahalgam attack, include the suspension of the Indus Waters Treaty, impacting Pakistan's water resources and agriculture. A complete ban on direct and indirect trade further cripples Pakistan's economy by blocking $500 million in goods.

title: Lashkar terrorists killed in J&K's Shopian: What we know about them
content: In Jammu and Kashmir's Shopian, three Lashkar-e-Taiba terrorists were killed during Operation Keller. The Rashtriya Rifles Unit acted on intelligence regarding terrorist presence. Shahid Kuttay and Adnan Shafi Dar were identified among the deceased. Kuttay was involved in attacks on tourists and a BJP Sarpanch. Dar participated in the killing of a non-local labourer.

title: Anushka Sharma-Virat Kohli meet Premanand Maharaj in Vrindavan: Top 5 news
content: Anushka Sharma and Virat Kohli sought blessings in Vrindavan, while Raj Babbar shared emotional memories of Smita Patil. Navya Naveli Nanda is pursuing entrepreneurship, and Ajay and Yug Devgn are dubbing for 'Karate Kid: Legends.' RJ Mahvash humorously addressed her approach to love amidst rumors with Yuzvendra Chahal, creating buzz in entertainment headlines.

title: How Joe Cardona was signed by the Miami Dolphins within 10 days
content: Mike Vrabel explained the Patriots' decision to release Joe Cardona. They signed Frederick Julian Ashby II. Vrabel cited Ashby's potential as the reason. Joe Cardona, a long-time Patriot, then joined the Miami Dolphins. This move marks the end of an era for some Patriots fans. Social media reacted strongly to Cardona's departure and subsequent signing with a division rival.

title: Anupamaa's Rupali Ganguly urges celebs and citizens to #BoycottTurkey amid India-Pakistan conflict
content: Rupali Ganguly, famed as Anupamaa, staunchly defended India amidst rising tensions with Pakistan. She rebuked Pakistani actor Fawad Khan's criticism of Operation Sindoor, asserting his work in Indian films was also 'shameful'. Ganguly urged Indians to boycott Turkey for its controversial stance.

title: RJ Mahvash calls herself 'dumb' in love amid dating rumours with Chahal
content: Social media sensation RJ Mahvash is making her acting debut in the web series 'Pyaar Paisa Profit.' Amidst promotions, she revealed her relatable approach to love, admitting to overlooking red flags, similar to her character. Previously, Mahvash and cricketer Yuzvendra Chahal sparked dating rumors, which they denied, though public support continues.

title: CBSE results: 93.66% pass in class 10, 88.39% in class 12
content: The CBSE has declared the Class 10 and 12 results for 2025, with pass percentages of 93.66% and 88.39% respectively. Girls outperformed boys, and southern regions like Trivandrum and Vijaywada topped in both boards. Foreign schools and CWSN candidates delivered impressive performances, while over 3 lakh students scored above 90%. Despite a high number of achievers, over 1.4 lakh students in Class 10 were placed in the Compartment category, highlighting areas needing academic intervention.

title: Anushka Sharma visits Vrindavan with Virat Kohli after his retirement
content: Following his Test cricket retirement announcement, Virat Kohli and Anushka Sharma sought blessings at Vrindavan's Kelly Kunj Ashram from Shri Premanand Govind Sharan Ji Maharaj. A video showed the couple's humble visit, highlighting their spiritual connection with the guru. Anushka inquired about the power of chanting, receiving an insightful response about finding peace through devotion.

title: Tendulkar and Kohli gave India 33 years of stability at No. 4. Who next?
content: With Virat Kohli retiring from Test cricket ahead of the five-match Test series in England, the big question for Gautam Gambhir and Ajit Agarkar will be who bats at No. 4 for India in Test cricket. The position for the past three decades has been owned by Sachin Tendulkar and Virat Kohli. Now, with Virat's announcement, India will have to look for options. Timesofindia.com spoke to several experts on figuring out who can be India's next mainstay.

title: Viral video: Virat Kohli speaks for the first time since Test retirement
content: Virat Kohli and Anushka Sharma visited Vrindavan Dham after Kohli's Test retirement. They sought blessings from Swami Premanand Maharaj. A video shows Kohli expressing peace with his decision. Kohli's retirement marks the end of a significant Test career. He leaves behind a legacy of runs and leadership. His influence will continue to shape Indian cricket.

title: IndiGo, Air India cancel flights to these airports - check list
content: Amidst tensions between India and Pakistan, airlines like Air India and IndiGo cancelled flights to several northern destinations on May 13th after briefly resuming services. The shutdown of 32 airports had earlier severely affected flight services, resulting in more than 300 daily flight cancellations.

title: Virat Kohli: The dressing room DJ who nailed Ishant Sharma's mimicry
content: Virat Kohli's sudden retirement from Test cricket has sent ripples through the cricketing world. Among those is his former India and Delhi teammate, Shikhar Dhawan. In an exclusive interview, Dhawan fondly recalls not just Kohli's on-field heroics but also his vibrant presence in the dressing room. From celebrating Dhawan's debut century with infectious energy to his playful mimicry of teammates like Ishant Sharma, Dhawan paints a picture of Kohli's multifaceted personality.

title: Posters of Pahalgam attack suspects surface; Rs 20 lakh bounty announced
content: Following the deadly Pahalgam terror attack on April 22, which killed 26 people, Jammu and Kashmir Police released photographs of three suspects, offering a ‚Çπ20 lakh reward for information. The TRF claimed responsibility, leading to India's Operation Sindoor targeting terrorist installations in Pakistan.

title: "Had Indira Gandhi Been Alive, I Would Have Asked Her...": Himanta Sarma
content: Assam Chief Minister Himanta Sarma on Tuesday said had former Prime Minister Indira Gandhi been alive, he would have questioned her about the strategic decisions she made during the 1971 Bangladesh Liberation War.

title: Trump Cuts Cancer Research Funding By 31% In First 3 Months Of 2025: Report
content: US President Donald Trump's administration slashed cancer research funding by 31 per cent in the first three months of 2025 compared to the same period last year, according to a Senate report.

title: China Upset With Pakistan Over Method Of Ceasefire? What The Chronology Reveals
content: As the dust settles after a series of Pakistani escalations and Indian military responses during Operation Sindoor, the focus now shifts to what really went down on the day the dramatic ceasefire was announced.

title: "Speak In Marathi Or Won't Pay": Mumbai Couple Harasses Pizza Delivery Agent
content: For this Mumbai couple, the pizza was not enough, they also wanted the person delivering it to be able to speak to them in Marathi, a detail that they failed to mention when they placed the order, fanning the Hindi-Marathi language row.

title: "World Knows Whose Son Made India Proud": Air Marshal Bharti's Mother
content: In the armed forces' briefing on Sunday, after the ceasefire was announced, one of the most important and articulate voices was that of Awadhesh Kumar Bharti, the Director General of Air Operations.

title: 5 Arrested, 7 Boys Detained For Sexually Assaulting Girl In Tamil Nadu: Cops
content: Five men were arrested and seven minors were detained in Tamil Nadu's Pallavaram, near Chennai, for allegedly sexually assaulting a 13-year-old girl several times.

title: Ex-Army Man Hacked To Death, Body Chopped Into Pieces By Wife, Lover: Cops
content: A 44-year-old woman, with the help of her lover and two others, allegedly hacked her ex-army soldier husband into six pieces in a village here, police on Tuesday said.

title: Zelensky Says Only Meeting Putin Face-To-Face Can Deliver Peace
content: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky said on Tuesday he wanted to negotiate an unconditional 30-day ceasefire face-to-face with Vladimir Putin at this week's talks in Istanbul because only the Russian leader could enact such a pause.

title: "I Forgive You": Kim Kardashian To Man Accused In Paris Hotel Robbery
content: Reality TV star Kim Kardashian told a Paris court on Tuesday that she forgave the main defendant accused of holding her at gunpoint to steal $10 million of jewellery in her hotel room during a 2016 robbery.

title: Husband's Extramarital Affair Not Cruelty, Abetment Of Suicide: Delhi High Court
content: The Delhi High Court on Tuesday said a man's extramarital affair does not amount to cruelty or abetment of suicide unless shown it harassed or tormented the wife.

title: BJP-Led NDA Sweeps Panchayat Polls In Assam
content: The Bharatiya Janata Party-led National Democratic Alliance (NDA) has secured a sweeping victory in the 2025 Assam Panchayat elections, consolidating its political dominance in the state.

title: High Court Judges' "Unnecessary" Coffee Breaks Find Mention In Top Court
content: High court judges taking breaks "unnecessarily" and too often found a mention in the Supreme Court on Tuesday, which called for their performance audits.

title: Blog: Reporter's Diary: "When Bombs Don't See Your Religion"
content: I wasn't there in Pahalgam. But I read several reports - stories that felt like a heavy burden I couldn't shake off. The victims' relatives said the terrorists asked names and religion before pulling the trigger. Those who weren't Muslims were shot.

title: "Looking Square In The Eye...": Shashi Tharoor On PM Modi's Pak Conflict Speech
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi handled the conflict between India and Pakistan "extremely well", Congress MP Shashi Tharoor on Tuesday said, as he praised him for Operation Sindoor and sending a clear message through his first address a day earlier.

title: Warplanes, Chandeliers: Trump Gets Royal Welcome In Saudi Arabia
content: With fighter jets and mounted cavalry, Saudi Arabia's Crown Prince Mohamed bin Salman gave Donald Trump a lavish royal welcome in Riyadh Tuesday, as the president kicked off a multi-day tour of the Gulf.

title: BSF Jawan Injured In Pakistani Shelling At J&K Border Dies
content: A Border Security Force (BSF) jawan, who was wounded in Pakistan shelling at the Jammu and Kashmir border, succumbed and his body is likely to reach his native village, Badharia on Tuesday.

title: Bomb Scare On Mumbai-Bound IndiGo Flight At Kolkata Airport, Passenger Detained
content: A plane of a private airline was taken to the isolation bay at the Kolkata airport on Tuesday afternoon for a thorough security check after a passenger was suspected of carrying a bomb, officials said.

title: "Woman From Same Community...": Minister's Remarks On Army Officer Spark Row
content: A Madhya Pradesh minister has sparked a political storm with remarks seen as referring to Army Colonel Sofiya Qureshi, one of the officers who led the government briefings on Operation Sindoor.

title: Exclusive: Before-After Satellite Pics Show Damage To Pak Bases After Indian Strikes
content: India struck multiple Pakistani air bases during 'Operation Sindoor', damaging runways, hangars, and buildings, causing a massive blow to Pakistan.

title: Opinion: Opinion | 'I Did It My Way': What The Timing Of Virat's Exit Says About Him
content: Remember the song Virat Kohli chose for his retirement post on Instagram? Frank Sinatra's evergreen classic, 'My way'. That's the way he played his cricket, and that's the way he chose to ride off into the Test sunset.

title: India briefs 70 Foreign Service Attaches on Operation Sindoor; China, Turkiye not invited
content: Pakistan Military announces that 11 personnel were killed and 78 others injured during confrontation with India

title: Bihar introduces French and German language courses in 15 engineering colleges
content: Chief Secretary inaugurates foreign language initiative to boost global competence among technical students; plan to expand to all 38 government engineering colleges

title: Southwest monsoon advances to the Andaman Sea
content: The monsoon has reached the region over a week earlier as compared to historical data, the IMD has announced, with the expacted onset date over Kerala not yet revealed by the meteorologists.

title: Maharashtra police on alert after anonymous bomb threat email
content: State Disaster Management Control Room receives message warning of possible blast; source under investigation amid heightened India-Pakistan tensions

title: Researchers develop new metal-free organic catalyst which can produce hydrogen fuel by harvesting mechanical energy
content: According to the Department of Science and Technology, in order to reduce global warming and the related impact of fossil fuels, the transition towards sustainable alternatives based on renewable energy becomes increasingly critical

title: Tamil Nadu has given the Armed Forces its all, be it war with China or Pakistan
content: Whenever India is forced into an armed conflict, the State has always stood behind the Centre.¬†Its leaders and people, setting aside their differences, have offered everything, from blood to bullion. Chief Minister¬†M.K. Stalin leading a march last week in solidarity with the Armed Forces, after ‚ÄòOperation¬†Sindoor‚Äô was launched, fit in with this tradition

title: SC issues notices to govt. on extended internship, fee charged from medical students who fled war, pandemic
content: ‚ÄòThe pandemic and/or Russia-Ukraine war had interrupted their education and they have already lost more than one year to complete the course,‚Äô the petition said

title:
When¬†Jayalalithaa¬†government wanted¬†
Poes Garden declared a ‚Äòno flying zone‚Äô
content: The government claimed that around 3¬†a.m. on May 4, the men on sentry duty had sighted a glider-type aircraft, with no lights, making two or three sorties¬†over her ‚ÄòVeda¬†Nilayam‚Äô bungalow. The police had earlier been informed of a likely threat to the Chief Minister from the¬†LTTE, which was banned after¬†Rajiv Gandhi was assassinated

title: All 13 accused in Murshidabad father-son murder are locals, some known to the family
content: Father-son duo Harogobind Das and Chandan Das were killed allegedly in communal violence in Murshidabad‚Äôs Samserganj police station area on April 12, following protests against the recently passed Waqf (Amendment) Act, 2025¬†

title: Nagpur court extends Kerala journalist‚Äôs police custody
content: Custody had been extended for the ‚Äòpurpose of interrogation regarding the seized electronic devices, and for proper investigation of the crime,‚Äô the court said

title: Congress seeks Prime Minister‚Äôs clarification over U.S. claims of mediation
content: Congress asks if Modi government will conduct a Kargil Review Committee-type exercise to probe the Pahalgam terror attack.

title: Nitish Kumar pays tribute to martyred BSF jawan Muhammad Imtiaz
content: Chief Minister visits Saran district to meet family; ‚Çπ50 lakh ex gratia and government job assured; separate tribute for second martyr Rambabu Singh

title: AP will build port-based economy to harness 1,000-km coastline, says Chandrababu Naidu
content: The Chief Minister said that the State will work towards establishing a port or fishing harbour every 50 kilometres to spur economic growth, employment, and infrastructure development

title: Judiciary has to earn public respect, not try to command it: Chief Justice Khanna
content: CJI Khanna showed firm and principled leadership in addressing instances of judicial misconduct, says Justice Gavai

title: Minister Uttam Reddy hits out at Harish Rao, rebuts allegations on paddy procurement
content: Procurement of paddy as on May 12 is 44% higher compared to same day last year; farmers paid ‚Çπ6,671 crore out of ‚Çπ9,999 crore so far

title: Tripura inducts 332 women constables in major recruitment drive
content: 332 women among 975 constables recruited in State‚Äôs largest single induction drive; Chief Minister links initiative to anti-drug campaign

title: 5th president for Munnar panchayat in four years
content: Congress member M. Manimozhi elected president securing 11 votes, against LDF‚Äôs Jyothi Satheesh Kumar who got eight votes

title: Norms for reapportionment of teaching staff in State-run schools announced in A.P.
content: The Director of School Education submitted a proposal on conversion and creations of posts, which the government has approved, according to the proposal some School Assistant posts would be converted as Model Primary School Headmasters/School Assistants

title: Fingerlings of yellow catfish released to Chalakudy river
content: The programme, organised by the Centre for Peninsular Aquatic Genetics Resources (PAGR) of the National Bureau of Fish Genetic Resources (NBFGR), took place near Vettilappara

title: Mysuru: CFTRI can emerge as a launchpad for entrepreneurs, says expert
content: The institute in Mysuru can invest in AI capacity-building, collaborating with tech institutions, bringing in data scientists, and building AI-ready labs, suggests TiE Mysuru chapter president

title: Govt. declares human-wildlife conflict State-specific disaster to expedite relief disbursal
content: Government states that the administration will disburse relief to victims  irrespective of whether the encounters occurred inside protected wildlife reserves or outside the perimeter of such sanctuaries.¬†It also establishes detailed norms for compensating victims of such conflicts and finalised a table for recompense based on the severity of injuries and the extent of financial loss¬†

title: BJP holds memorial meet for Sushil Kumar Modi on first death anniversary
content: Senior BJP and NDA leaders recall the late leader‚Äôs legacy in governance and party-building; Nitish Kumar unveils memorial park in his honour

title: People‚Äôs campaign to develop Chakkaraparambu-Infopark road gathers momentum
content: Thrikkakara MLA demands allocation of funds to realise the long-overdue eastward extension of the M.G. Road‚ÄìPullepady‚ÄìThammanam‚ÄìChakkaraparambu road towards Infopark through Vennala, Palachuvadu, Kalachal, Thuthiyoor, and Seaport‚ÄìAirport Road

title: Five drinking water plants opened in Udayagiri constituency
content: With this, the number of water plants inaugurated through the VPR Foundation in SPSR Nellore district touches 170

title: Health Minister expresses ire over graft allegations on govt. medical officers, calls for immediate corrective steps
content: A few District Medical and Health Officers and District Health Services Coordinators need to improve their performance, says Satya Kumar Yadav at a review meet

title: Adikavi Nannaya varsity plans botanical garden to boost green cover on campus
content: The upcoming botanical garden will have plant species specific to the region, and will be a learning and resource centre for botany students

title: Five-day mango mela begins in Dharwad
content: The five-day ‚ÄòMango Mela‚Äô organised with the objective of providing a market sans middlemen to the mango growers, began in Dharwad on Tuesday with Deputy Commissioner Divya Prabhu G.R.J. formerly inaugurating it and savouring the ‚Äòking of fruits‚Äô.

title: Restoration of remaining 200 metres of Mullassery canal likely to be taken up after monsoon
content: Of the total 829-metre stretch of the canal, the Irrigation department claims to have completed the restoration of 625 metres. The stretch between Chittoor Road and M.G. Road remains to be restored

title: TTD to temporarily resume recommendation letters for VIP darshan from May 15
content: TTD had earlier decided not to entertain any recommendation letters from May 1 till July 15 in order to accommodate the pilgrim crowd which touches its peak during the summer vacations

title: Tribal children from Sabarimala forests step outside with English on their lips
content: Communicore launched by the Kudumbashree District Mission in Pathanamthitta aims at training Malaipandaram children in communicative English

title: Cong. leadership meeting in New Delhi ahead of organisational revamp to make party election-ready
content: Leader of the Opposition V.D. Satheesan says the accent is on creating a rainbow coalition of leaders from different socio-religious backgrounds to marshal diverse sections of society under UDF banner

title: Ministers inaugurate 33/11 kv sub-station in Kakinada village
content: New sub-stations will be built in the State basing on requirement, says Energy Minister Gottipati Ravi Kumar

title: BJP to launch ‚ÄòTiranga Yatra‚Äô in poll-bound Bihar on May 14; Oppn accuses BJP of taking political advantage of Operation Sindoor
content: Tejashwi Yadav took a dig at the BJP over the yatra, said ‚Äòarmed forces must not be into politics‚Äô; Congress leaders said the ruling BJP is trying to cash in politically and electorally on the success of Operation Sindoor

title: Government will extend full support for Taekwondo tournaments: Minister
content: International coach Abbas Sheikhi travelled from Iran and shared with the participants about the rules, regulations and techniques

title: Pollachi sexual assault case verdict 2025: a package
content: A compilation of The Hindu‚Äôs coverage on the judgment given in the 2019 Pollachi sexual assault case in May 2025

title: JSP leaders conduct special prayers at various temples for Indian armed  forces

title: BRS holds govt. responsible for heat-stroke deaths of farmers waiting for disposal of paddy
content: Party leader T. Harish Rao demands ex gratia payment to families concerned stating that they are deaths due to govt. negligence

title: Rahul Gandhi to interact with Bihar students on May 15: Kanhaiya Kumar
content: The NSUI national in-charge alleged that the education system of Bihar has become the biggest failure of the double engine government led by Chief Minister Nitish Kumar

title: Andrew Painter and other prospects on the rise
content: the Philadelphia Phillies have one of the top pitching rotations in the major leagues . they haven't seen much of painter in actual games . the 22-year-old is a 2021 first-round pick .

title: NBA playoff futures: Thunder move to odds-on championship favorite
content: the Oklahoma City Thunder are the odds-on favorite to win the 2025 NBA Championship . the Thunder moved to -105 win the Finals with the New York Knicks jumping from 18-1 to the second-shortest favorite at +500 .

title: MMA divisional rankings: Jack Della Maddalena not alone in making a move in top 10
content: the welterweight champion now owns the no. 1 spot in ESPN's 170-pound rankings . the australian used crisp striking footwork to dethrone Belal Muhammad . Valentina Shevchenko remains at No. 1 despite the loss .

title: If Flick can make Barcelona more boring, they'll become unstoppable
